snippet.textDisplay: I played this game on release and eventually did everything there was to do.  I'm with you Preach.  I think the story is convoluted garbage that snows people with floury dialogue and dozens of names/locations.  You gave it the respect it deserves.
snippet.textOriginal: I played this game on release and eventually did everything there was to do.  I'm with you Preach.  I think the story is convoluted garbage that snows people with floury dialogue and dozens of names/locations.  You gave it the respect it deserves.

snippet.textDisplay:
It's finally over, I'm guessing?  I can't be sure since the VoD just ends suddenly, but he's right at the end so I assume there was more.  This is the worst playthrough I've seen both from Preach and of this game in general.  I'm not sure how this got so out of hand so quickly.  

Stuff like the dumb fart noise donations by SeriousSion early on and consistently throughout the game definitely set the tone for this to be an awful experience.  Combine it with the absolute refusal to engage with any story elements, fast skipping dialogue because it was during combat, and a complete lack of understanding for the gameplay elements to give himself any sort of advantage...  I'm frankly shocked that the new higher difficulty option allowed this type of gameplay to succeed in clearing the game, even worse that it was while under-leveled...  Like, several areas in this VoD alone, he has the option to hit a target, like a knight, from the side or from the front, and places himself to attack from the front.  There was no other tactical merit to it outside of just still not understanding that you have a higher success rate from the sides and even better from the back.  

It just felt like he wasn't in an RPG mindset for this one, and should've just played it later when he was in the mood.

snippet.textDisplay:
Honestly probably one of the worst preach play throughs I have seen. Doesn’t bother to connect with the game mechanics or story more than absolutely necessary to beat the current level. He would never admit it but he would have enjoyed a less difficult option. He had to rng his way through like a good chunk of the fights in the game. Tbh fft isn’t really a great game for streaming so I’m not that bothered by it. 

I’m really forward to yakuza tho.

snippet.textDisplay: the vod sortof just ends, is the rest of the stream no longer available?
snippet.textOriginal: the vod sortof just ends, is the rest of the stream no longer available?

snippet.textDisplay:
This was one of the most painful playthroughs I've seen in nearly 13 years with this channel. I don't know what the mindset was, maybe because it wasn't a mainline numbered game or if the combat was too much of his focus, but watching him flat out disregard the story because he refused to pay attention or look into world building like the tavern rumors. It's genuinely not overly difficult to understand and keep track of the story. Instead of using any of the resources available to clear things up, dialogue started getting skipped, you rush through or straight up ignore story beats (a voiced cutscene that specifically states that a civil war has begun, and minutes later during dialogue a character mentions the war and preach goes "wait, there's a war?"). 

The shitty gags and visuals from chris are personally never funny and detract from the game being played, the fart sound effect ruining cutscenes which only further pushed mike out of it more than he already was. Spending I think it was around five hours slamming your head against a fight that you're clearly not prepared for, effectively wasting yours and the audience's time. Five hours. You could have gone out, done some sped up auto battle leveling for 30, 40 minutes, gained a few levels to make that penultimate fight a more even fight (because story mission enemies have fixed levels) instead of the enemy team stomping you into the pavement, and made it BACK to that fight in well under five hours, and for some reason you refuse. That was hours of time wasted because you refused to even mildly adjust your mindset and simply grind a little bit.

If mike or anyone from the team ever sees this, I've stuck around for so long because the vast majority of the time I love it here, but holy shit...

snippet.textDisplay:
The fact that he streamed this long means that he really wanted to get FFT over it...


which is fairly a good thing because this was one of the most horrendous playthrough I've ever watched.

-Discards story by not making efforts to pay attention (talking to chat over scenes, fart donos, skipping then asks whats going on)

5:02:32 even baffles me considering what I said above

-Rushing final dungeon underleveled with a suboptimal set up and stats for his units
